Furthermore, thereMinute 4.) was reason to believe that most of the trouble had arisen as theresult of messages from India by Reuter's.In these circumstances, the War Cabinet (1) Agreed that it was unnecessary for a meeting to be held with the Editors.(2) Invited the Secretary of State for India to consult withthe Minister of Information, and to see representativesof Reuter's (who were now subject to a measure ofGovernment control) and give them directions as to theform of their messages from India, in order to avoid further misrepresentation of the position.Great George Street, S.W. 1,August 13, 1942.
